intro: Perymenium tehuacanum, commonly known as the Tehuacan wild cucumber, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes other cucurbits like pumpkins and melons. The plant produces yellow flowers and edible fruits that are typically harvested when mature. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a rough texture. Perymenium tehuacanum is adapted to grow in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
